Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery mug; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; parts of three lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres above red band lined in white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreparts of sphinx to right (top of head, body and lower part of leg lost; faded red patches on hair, wing and body).
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies this sherd as coming from a chalice, but the shape is distinctly different and belongs to a mug.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 855)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1928) (phase 2)
